member.name: M:Rebex.LogWriterBase.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Dispose(bool disposing) executes in two distinct scenarios. If disposing equals true, the method has been called directly or indirectly by a user's code. Managed and unmanaged resources can be disposed. If disposing equals false, the method has been called by the runtime from inside the finalizer and you should not reference other objects. Only unmanaged resources can be disposed.
member.param: If true, is called by IDisposable.Dispose. Otherwise it is called by finalizer.

member.name: M:Rebex.IO.FileSystemItemCollection.GetFiles(System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex)
member.summary: Returns the paths of files in the collection that match the specified search pattern.
member.param: The regular expression to match the paths or filenames against.
member.returns: A array containing the paths or names of files in the specified directory that match the specified search pattern.
member.remarks:
The method works in two different modes (determined by property):
Filenames without path are searched and returned. This mode is used by default for collections returned by GetList method.
Filenames with path are searched and returned. This mode is used by default for collection returned by GetItems method.

member.name: M:Rebex.IO.FileSystemItemCollection.GetFiles(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the names of files in the collection that match the specified search pattern.
member.param: The search string to match the items against.
If tree, perform unix-like case-sensitive matching.
member.returns: A array containing the names of files in the specified directory that match the specified search pattern.

remarks.p:
The following wildcards are permitted in searchPattern:
* - Zero or more characters.
? - Exactly one character.
Characters other than the wildcards represent themselves. For example, the searchPattern string "*.txt" searches for all names/paths ending with the ".txt". The searchPattern string "s*" searches for all names/paths beginning with the letter "s".

The method works in two different modes (determined by property):
Filenames without path are searched and returned. This mode is used by default for collections returned by GetList method.
Filenames with path are searched and returned. This mode is used by default for collection returned by GetItems method.

member.name: M:Rebex.IO.FileSystemItemCollection.GetFiles(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the names of files in the collection that match the specified search pattern.
member.param: The search string to match the items against.
member.returns: A array containing the names of files in the specified directory that match the specified search pattern.

remarks.p:
The following wildcard specifiers are permitted in searchPattern:
* - Zero or more characters.
? - Exactly one character.
Characters other than the wild card specifiers represent themselves. For example, the searchPattern string "*t" searches for all names in path ending with the letter "t". The searchPattern string "s*" searches for all names in path beginning with the letter "s".

The method works in two different modes (determined by property):
Filenames without path are searched and returned. This mode is used by default for collections returned by GetList method.
Filenames with path are searched and returned. This mode is used by default for collection returned by GetItems method.

member.summary: Time is taken as is.
member.remarks: Useful when working with NTFS file system.

member.name: F:Rebex.TimeComparisonGranularity.Seconds
member.summary: The smallest time unit is one second (milliseconds are ignored). E.g. 11:33:55.999 is rounded to 11:33:55.000.
member.remarks: Useful when working with some UNIX FTP or SFTP servers.

member.name: F:Rebex.TimeComparisonGranularity.TwoSeconds
member.summary: The smallest time unit is two-second. So odd seconds are rounded to lower even value (milliseconds are ignored). E.g. 11:33:55.999 is rounded to 11:33:54.000.
member.remarks: Useful when working with FAT file system (.NET CF, MS-DOS).

member.name: F:Rebex.TimeComparisonGranularity.Days
member.summary: The smallest time unit is one day (time component is ignored). E.g. 2012-12-12 11:33:55.999 is rounded to 2012-12-12 00:00:00.000.
member.remarks: Useful when working with some UNIX FTP or SFTP servers.

member.name: M:Rebex.IO.FileSet.Include(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a path or mask into collection of inclusion patterns. The supported wildcards are '?' and '*' and '**'. For detailed specification with examples see the documentation.
member.param: A path or mask (relative to the base path) which define an inclusion pattern.

member.name: M:Rebex.IO.FileSet.Include(System.String,Rebex.IO.TraversalMode)
member.summary: Adds a path or mask into collection of inclusion patterns. The supported wildcards are '?' and '*' and '**'. For detailed specification with examples see the documentation.
member.param: A path or mask (relative to the base path) which define an inclusion pattern.
Specifies traversal mode of directories for the .
member.remarks:
'?' matches any single character.
'*' matches any number of any characters except the directory separators.
'**' matches any number of any characters (directory separators can be reduced e.g. "a\**\b" is equivalent to "a\**\**\b" which matches "a\x\y\z\b" and also "a\b" but not "ab").

tr.td: Matches files within the "data" directory e.g. "data\file-007.txt", but not "data\file-7.txt".
Matches any ".txt" file within the "data" directory (only within the "data" directory, not in subdirectories) e.g. "data\file.txt", but not "data\a\b\c\file.txt".
Matches any ".txt" file anywhere within the "data" directory and its subdirectories e.g. "data\file.txt" and also "data\a\b\c\file.txt".

member.name: M:Rebex.IO.FileSet.Exclude(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a path or mask into collection of exclusion patterns. The supported wildcards are '?' and '*' and '**'. For detailed specification with examples see the documentation.
member.param: A path or mask (relative to the base path) which define an exclusion pattern.

member.name: M:Rebex.IO.FileSet.Exclude(System.String,Rebex.IO.TraversalMode)
member.summary: Adds a path or mask into collection of exclusion patterns. The supported wildcards are '?' and '*' and '**'. For detailed specification with examples see the documentation.
member.param: A path or mask (relative to the base path) which define an exclusion pattern.
Specifies traversal mode of directories for the .
member.remarks:
'?' matches any single character.
'*' matches any number of any characters except the directory separators.
'**' matches any number of any characters (directory separators can be reduced e.g. "a\**\b" is equivalent to "a\**\**\b" which matches "a\x\y\z\b" and also "a\b" but not "ab").

tr.td: Matches files within the "data" directory e.g. "data\file-007.txt", but not "data\file-7.txt".
Matches any ".txt" file within the "data" directory (only within the "data" directory, not in subdirectories) e.g. "data\file.txt", but not "data\a\b\c\file.txt".
Matches any ".txt" file anywhere within the "data" directory and its subdirectories e.g. "data\file.txt" and also "data\a\b\c\file.txt".

member.summary:
Gets a collection of local file system items (files and directories) which matches this . Only items which matches no exclusion pattern and matches at leas one inclusion pattern are included into result collection. It doesn't depend on the order how the inclusion and exclusion patterns were added into the .
If you don't want to include empty directories into result collection, please set the to false.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a consumer of the should flatten the output. Flatten means to don't persist directory structure. member.name: T:Rebex.Security.Cryptography.DSAManaged
member.summary: Managed implementation of DSA signature algorithm.

remarks.p: The purpose of this class is to make it possible to verify signatures without the need to use CryptoAPI, which is not available in some scenarios.
Even though it is possible to generate DSA keys and sign data using this class, but this process has not been optimized for speed and is very slow.

member.name: M:Rebex.Security.Cryptography.DSAManaged.CreateSignature(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates the DSA signature for the specified data.
member.param: The SHA1 hash of data to be signed.
member.returns: The DSA signature for the specified hash value.
member.remarks: DSA signature is a pair of numbers r and s. This method always returns an array of 40 bytes. Bytes 0..19 contain the value of r, bytes 20..39 contain the value of s.

member.name: M:Rebex.Security.Cryptography.DSAManaged.VerifySignature(System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: Verifies the DSA signature for the specified data.
member.param: The SHA1 hash of signed data to be verified.
The signature to be verified for rgbData.
member.returns: true if the signature verifies as valid; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: DSA signature is a pair of numbers r and s. The rgbSignature parameter must be 40 bytes long. Bytes 0..19 must contain the value of r, bytes 20..39 must contain the value of s.

member.summary: Computes the signature for the specified hash value by signing it with the private key.

member.name: T:Rebex.Security.Cryptography.HMAC
member.summary: Computes a Hash-based Message Authentication Code (HMAC) for the input data using the specified hash function.
member.remarks:
HMAC is defined by RFC 2104 and look like this: alg(K XOR opad + alg(K XOR ipad + text))
where alg is the base hash algorithm,
K is an n byte key,
ipad is the byte 0x36 repeated 64 times (or 128 times),
opad is the byte 0x5c repeated 64 times (or 128 times),
and text is the data being protected.

member.name: T:Rebex.Security.Cryptography.RSAManaged
member.summary: Managed implementation of RSA algorithm.
member.p: The purpose of this class is to make it possible to verify signatures and encrypt data without the need to use CryptoAPI, which is not available in some scenarios.
Even though it is possible to generate RSA keys and sign data using this class, it is not recommended because the generated keys are not being checked to ensure they are strong primes.

member.name: F:Rebex.Security.Certificates.ValidationStatus.TimeNotValid
member.summary: This certificate or one of the certificates in the certificate chain is not time valid.

member.name: F:Rebex.Security.Certificates.ValidationStatus.TimeNotNested
member.summary: Certificates in the chain are not properly time nested.

member.name: F:Rebex.Security.Certificates.ValidationStatus.Revoked
member.summary: Trust for this certificate or one of the certificates in the certificate chain has been revoked.

member.name: F:Rebex.Security.Certificates.ValidationStatus.SignatureNotValid
member.summary: The certificate or one of the certificates in the certificate chain does not have a valid signature.

member.name: F:Rebex.Security.Certificates.ValidationStatus.WrongUsage
member.summary: The certificate or certificate chain is not valid for its proposed usage.

member.name: F:Rebex.Security.Certificates.ValidationStatus.RootNotTrusted
member.summary: The certificate or certificate chain is based on an untrusted root.

member.name: F:Rebex.Security.Certificates.ValidationStatus.UnknownRev
member.summary: The revocation status of the certificate or one of the certificates in the certificate chain is unknown.

member.name: F:Rebex.Security.Certificates.ValidationStatus.CyclicChain
member.summary: One of the certificates in the chain was issued by a certification authority that the original certificate had certified.

member.name: F:Rebex.Security.Certificates.ValidationStatus.InvalidExtension
member.summary: One of the certificates has an invalid extension.

member.name: F:Rebex.Security.Certificates.ValidationStatus.InvalidPolicyConstraints
member.summary: The certificate or one of the certificates in the certificate chain has a policy constraints extension, and one of the issued certificates has a disallowed policy mapping extension or does not have a required issuance policies extension.

member.name: F:Rebex.Security.Certificates.ValidationStatus.InvalidBasicConstraints
member.summary: The certificate or one of the certificates in the certificate chain has a basic constraints extension and either the certificate cannot be used to issue other certificates or the chain path length has been exceeded.

member.name: F:Rebex.Security.Certificates.ValidationStatus.InvalidNameConstraints
member.summary: The certificate or one of the certificates in the certificate chain has an invalid name constraints extension.

member.name: F:Rebex.Security.Certificates.ValidationStatus.UnsupportedNameConstraint
member.summary: The certificate or one of the certificates in the certificate chain has a name constraints extension containing unsupported fields.

member.name: F:Rebex.Security.Certificates.ValidationStatus.NotDefinedNameConstraint
member.summary: The certificate or one of the certificates in the certificate chain has a name constraints extension and a name constraint is missing for one of the name choices in the end certificate.

member.name: F:Rebex.Security.Certificates.ValidationStatus.NotPermittedNameConstraint
member.summary: The certificate or one of the certificates in the certificate chain has a name constraints extension and there is not a permitted name constraint for one of the name choices in the end certificate.

member.name: F:Rebex.Security.Certificates.ValidationStatus.ExcludedNameConstraint
member.summary: The certificate or one of the certificates in the certificate chain has a name constraints extension and one of the name choices in the end certificate is explicitly excluded.

member.name: F:Rebex.Security.Certificates.ValidationStatus.IncompleteChain
member.summary: The certificate chain is not compete.

member.name: F:Rebex.Security.Certificates.ValidationStatus.CtlTimeNotValid
member.summary: A CTL used to create this chain was not time valid.

member.name: F:Rebex.Security.Certificates.ValidationStatus.CtlSignatureNotValid
member.summary: A CTL used to create this chain did not have a valid signature.

member.name: F:Rebex.Security.Certificates.ValidationStatus.CtlWrongUsage
member.summary: A CTL used to create this chain is not valid for this usage.

member.name: F:Rebex.Security.Certificates.ValidationStatus.OfflineRev
member.summary: The revocation status of the certificate or one of the certificates in the certificate chain is either off-line or stale.

member.name: F:Rebex.Security.Certificates.ValidationStatus.NoIssuanceChainPolicy
member.summary: The end certificate does not have any resultant issuance policies, and one of the issuing CA certificates has a policy constraints extension requiring it.

member.name: F:Rebex.Security.Certificates.ValidationStatus.UnsupportedSignatureAlgorithm
member.summary: The certificate chain contains a certificate with unsupported signature hash algorithm (usually SHA-2).

member.name: F:Rebex.Security.Certificates.ValidationStatus.UnknownError
member.summary: Unknown error.

member.name: F:Rebex.Security.Certificates.ValidationStatus.PathTooLong

member.name: F:Rebex.Security.Certificates.ValidationStatus.UnknownCriticalExtension

member.name: F:Rebex.Security.Certificates.ValidationStatus.InvalidChain

member.name: F:Rebex.Security.Certificates.ValidationStatus.UnknownCa

member.name: F:Rebex.Security.Certificates.ValidationStatus.CnNotMatch

member.name: T:Rebex.IO.TraversalMode
member.summary: Specifies how a search pattern is treated (how to traverse a hierarchy of directories).
member.remarks: See Using TraversalMode blog post for samples.

member.name: F:Rebex.IO.TraversalMode.Recursive
member.summary:
Performs shallow search for files and directories; do recursive transfer of matching directories.
Shallow search means that items are searched only in the first level of given directory.
If the pattern matches a file, the file is processed.
If the pattern matches a directory, all files and subdirectories are processed.

member.name: F:Rebex.IO.TraversalMode.NonRecursive
member.summary:
Performs shallow search for files and directories; do non-recursive transfer of matching directories.
Shallow search means that items are searched only in the first level of given directory.
If the pattern matches a file, the file is processed.
If the pattern matches a directory, only the directory itself is processed (without any content = empty directory will be created).

member.name: F:Rebex.IO.TraversalMode.MatchFilesShallow
member.summary:
Performs shallow search for files only. This is the same as mode, but only files are processed.
Shallow search means that files are searched only in the first level of given directory.

member.name: F:Rebex.IO.TraversalMode.MatchFilesDeep
member.summary:
Performs deep search for files only. This is like DOS xcopy deep file search.
Deep search means that files are searched in the given directory and also in all its subdirectories.
However, if this mode is used in GetItems method, returned collection will also contains directories where the files were found.
member.remarks: This behavior is useful in situations where you need to prepare the containing directory before the file is processed. To get only files, just use Linq like this: collection.Where(item => !item.IsDirectory)

member.name: T:Rebex.IO.ActionOnExistingFiles
member.summary: Specifies the default action to perform when a target file already exists. However, the default action can still be changed using the ProblemDetected event.

member.name: F:Rebex.IO.ActionOnExistingFiles.ThrowException
member.summary: Existing files are to cause the whole multi-file transfer to be canceled and an exception to be raised.

member.name: F:Rebex.IO.ActionOnExistingFiles.SkipAll
member.summary: Existing files are to be always skipped.

member.name: F:Rebex.IO.ActionOnExistingFiles.OverwriteAll
member.summary: Existing files are to be always overwritten.

member.name: F:Rebex.IO.ActionOnExistingFiles.OverwriteOlder
member.summary: Existing files are to be overwritten if they are older than source files. This is strongly discouraged because modification dates are often misreported by FTP and SFTP servers, making this mode highly unreliable. We strongly recommend to use a different mode or develop a custom solution using the ProblemDetected event.

member.name: F:Rebex.IO.ActionOnExistingFiles.OverwriteDifferentSize
member.summary: Existing files with different sizes are to be overwritten.

member.name: F:Rebex.IO.ActionOnExistingFiles.ResumeIfPossible
member.summary: Existing files are to be resumed if they are smaller than source files.

member.name: F:Rebex.IO.ActionOnExistingFiles.Rename
member.summary: Existing files are to be renamed according the pattern "filename[number].extension". You can still change the generated name using the ProblemDetected event and the method.

member.name: F:Rebex.IO.ActionOnExistingFiles.OverwriteDifferentChecksum
member.summary:
Existing files with different checksum are to be overwritten.
Works on FTP and ZIP only. ZIP uses CRC-32 always; FTP uses checksums provided by the server (some FTP servers support no checksums).

member.name: T:Rebex.IO.LinkProcessingMode
member.summary: Specifies behavior on links and reparse points in multi-file operations.

member.name: F:Rebex.IO.LinkProcessingMode.FollowLinks
member.summary: Detected links are to be resolved and processed - however, this can still be changed by ProblemDetected handler.

member.name: F:Rebex.IO.LinkProcessingMode.SkipLinks
member.summary: Detected links are to be skipped - however, this can still be changed by ProblemDetected handler.
